Tahun 2019 Mau Berakhir, Serapan Anggaran PUPR Masih 60%
05 Nov 2019, 07:48 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Foto: Basuki Hadimuljono (Andhika Prasetia/detikcom)

Jakarta - Serapan anggaran Kementerian Pekerjaan Umum dan Perumahan Rakyat (PUPR) dalam APBN 2019 masih rendah. Padahal praktis waktu penyelesaian APBN 2019 hanya menyisakan dua bulan lagi.Hal ini bahkan jadi perhatian oleh Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati. Menurut catatan Sri Mulyani, per akhir September 2019 lalu, kementerian yang mendapatkan alokasi anggaran Rp 110,7 triliun tersebut kurang dari 50%."Dari sisi jumlah penyerapan hingga akhir September, PUPR yang memiliki anggaran terbesar masih belum menyelesaikan 50 persen dari anggarannya," ujar Sri Mulyani saat rapat kerja (raker) dengan Komisi XI DPR, Jakarta, Senin (4/11) kemarin.Saat dikonfirmasi, Menteri PUPR Basuki Hadimuljono mengatakan serapan anggaran kementerian yang dipimpinnya per awal November 2019 ini telah menyentuh 60%. Basuki bilang, serapan anggaran yang rendah karena adanya keterlambatan lelang menyusul berubahnya pelaksana lelang di beberapa unit organisasi (unor)."Sudah 60%. Karena kita kan ada perubahan organisasi di awal. Yang tadinya dilelang oleh para unit organisasi SDA, Bina Marga saya kumpulkan jadi satu balai. Supaya standarisasinya jelas. Ini kecepatannya berkurang. Tapi sekarang semua sudah kontrak," kata Basuki saat ditemui di kantornya, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Meski saat ini posisi serapan anggaran masih di angka 60%, Basuki meyakini capaian di akhir tahun bakal melebihi dari 90%. Pasalnya, seluruh paket pekerjaan sudah berangsur dikontrakkan."Itu sudah kontrak semua. Jadi insyaallah kita monitor satu bulan ini harus serap Rp 20 triliun. Target kita 90-an persen sampai akhir tahun," ungkapnya.Untuk diketahui, setidaknya ada sembilan kementerian/lembaga yang memiliki serapan anggaran jauh lebih tinggi dari tahun sebelumnya per akhir September 2019.Serapan tertinggi dicetak oleh Kementerian Sosial yang mencapai 83,3% dari anggaran sebesar Rp 58,9 triliun. Selanjutnya Kepolisian RI yang mencapai 76,8% dari anggaran Rp 86,2 triliun.Sementara itu, serapan anggaran Kementerian Kesehatan mencapai 75,5% dari alokasi anggaran sebesar Rp 58,7 triliun. Serapan anggaran Kementerian Riset, Teknologi dan Pendidikan Tinggi (Ristekdikti) mencapai 68,6% dari alokasi Rp 41,3 triliun.Kemudian serapan anggaran Kementerian Agama mencapai 68% dari alokasi anggaran Rp 62,1 triliun. Lalu Kementerian Pertahanan mencapai 66,4% dari alokasi sebesar Rp 108,4 triliun.Terakhir, serapan Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan mencapai 61,4% dari alokasi anggaran sebesar Rp36 triliun.Simak Video "Djarot soal Anggaran Lem Aibon DKI: Bukan Semata-mata Salah Anies"[Gambas:Video 20detik](eds/zlf)

Year 2019 Want To End, PUPR Budget Absorption Is Still 60%
05 Nov 2019, 07:48 by Eduardo Simorangkir


Photo: Basuki Hadimuljono (Andhika Prasetia / detikcom)

Jakarta - The budget absorption of the Ministry of Public Works and Public Housing (PUPR) in the 2019 Budget is still low. In fact, the practical time for completing the 2019 State Budget has only two months left. This is even a concern of the Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati. According to Sri Mulyani, as of the end of September 2019, the ministry which received a budget allocation of Rp 110.7 trillion was less than 50%. "In terms of the amount of absorption up to the end of September, PUPR, which has the largest budget, has still not completed 50 percent of its budget," Sri Mulyani said during a working meeting with the House of Representatives Commission XI, Jakarta, Monday (4/11) yesterday. When confirmed, PUPR Minister Basuki Hadimuljono said the ministry's budget absorption as of early November 2019 had touched 60%. Basuki said, the low budget absorption due to the delay in the auction following the change in the implementation of the auction in several organizational units (unor). "It's been 60%. Because we had an organizational change in the beginning. What was auctioned by the SDA organizational units, Bina Marga I collected so one hall. So that the standardization is clear. This speed is reduced. But now everything has been contracted, "said Basuki when met at his office, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019). Although the current budget absorption position is still at 60%, Basuki believe the achievements at the end of the year will exceed 90%. This is because the entire work package has been contracted gradually. "That is all contracts. So God willing, we will monitor one month to absorb Rp. 20 trillion. Our target is 90 percent until the end of the year," he said. "For information, there are at least nine ministries / institutions. which has a much higher budget absorption than the previous year at the end of September 2019. The highest absorption was printed by the Ministry of Social Affairs which reached 83.3% of the budget of Rp 58.9 trillion. Furthermore, the Indonesian Police reached 76.8% of the budget of Rp. 86.2 trillion. Meanwhile, the Ministry of Health's budget absorption reached 75.5% of the budget allocation of Rp. 58.7 trillion. The budget absorption of the Ministry of Research, Technology and Higher Education (Ristekdikti) reached 68.6% of the Rp 41.3 trillion allocation. Then the Ministry of Religion's budget absorption reached 68% of the Rp 62.1 trillion budget allocation. Then the Ministry of Defense reached 66.4% of the allocation of Rp 108.4 trillion. Finally, the absorption of the Ministry of Education and Culture reached 61.4% of the budget allocation of Rp36 trillion. Wrong Anies "[Gambas: Video 20sec] (eds / zlf)
